column5: Hey guys/gals, quick question. Will shimano replace a V-Rod baitcast rod? The rod is discontinued and has a broken tip. Thanks for any info. Hope everyone is having a great summer fishing season
Call the Peterborough office and ask.  1-705-745-3232 427 Pido Rd Rr 6, Peterborough ON, K9J 6X7
Not a problem, it's the quickest route to answer your question.  In the past they've been pretty good to me.
They just told me that they can't do anything for me. It was a great rod and caught some big fish for me. Too bad
Too bad indeed, I know that they've being going through a lot of changes recently with their warranty program. I suspect it was getting costly.

There was a rather lenghy post here last year I believe about a member try to make a warranty claim for a V rod, if memory serves the Canadian office was not willing to do anything but oddly enough the American office was willing to honor the warranty. Can`t remember the member who started the thread or what the outcome was!
you mean this post?  page 3 from jedi... http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=44828&st=40
damn!!  I guess we'll all have to start buying St. Croix's!!  Did you hear that Shimano?!
Dont you ever work ? Send me that pic !

Limited Lifetime Warranty Rods Shimano will warranty the following rods. However, if they come to us appearing to be broken in a car door, look like they have been used excessively, or we were informed by the customer that it was broken in an accident, then Shimano will NOT warranty them.   ATL, CL "A" Seriec, CLC/CLS, CNC/CNS, CPC/CPS "A" & "B" Series, CRC/CRS, CSC/CSS, CUC/CUS, CVC/CVS, IGFA, PCF, SFS, TDR w/2 digit numbered models, TEC/TES, TFC/TFS, TLA, TLC/ TLS/ULC, TLI/TLR/TLT, TMC/TMS, TRC/TRS, TSC/TSS, TVC/TVS, ULC, V-RODS   If it is not on this list then Shimano will not warranty the rod without a valid receipt showing it to be still under one year and a new appearance.  Customer Service: 1-877-577-0600
Broken tip.. cut it clean and put a new tip on for less than the postage !
Thanks for all the help guys.

Broken tip.. cut it clean and put a new tip on for less than the postage !   My thoughts as well.  If the rod is that old and the tip just broke, pretty much garunteed it's not a manufacture defect.  I did this to a Crucial and I cannot notice a difference.
I did it to a $600 custom Musky rod.. that had blank replacement coverage!! Expecting manufacturers to cover stuff like this just costs everyone money.
The tip is broken all the way to the second guide. There is nowhere to add a new top guide.
Perfect.  There is your new 2oz jig slop punching rod.
Carefully cut it off at the base of the second guide and enjoy your new, heaver action rod.
